Summary I have been working in the I/T industry since 1993 when I started in the MIS Department and advanced to programmer postion in 1994 at Morton International. I worked on numerous platforms with PowerBuilder and C Development with 0% data loss as federal requirement. 
 
Upon graduating from Utah State, I started with IBM as an entry level developer. I quickly moved to a tech lead position. I then worked as a lead developer using MQ Series with C and PM/REXX. From there I moved into Lotus Notes Development. I worked Project ranging from service level reporting and Contract Renewal Management. As a Certified Notes Developer I worked on numerous dev/review teams to help others improve performance and scalability of their apps.  
 
I moved to an architect position in 2001. I have worked a number of projects as a Lead Architect. During one of the reorganizations I went through, my team ended up in the Systems Engineering organization. I trained and mentored under an outstanding SE and moved into a Lead SE position implementing/introducing the discipline on a number of different projects. I was lead SE on a couple projects that went thru SEI CMM Level 5 certification.  
 
During an high level engagement, I was asked to utilize my extensive data experience and lead a team to transform some key data quality areas in the organization. At this time I applied my SE and Architecture skills and folded them in with Data Quality and Data Management arena. I became a charter member of the IAIDQ. I have worked with Siebel Analytics, Informatica, DataStage and other ETL Tools. I have continued to expand my data modeling skills through Erwin and InfoSphere Data Architect and have a CBIP Certification. 
 
I Recently work on large scale divestiture primarily on data migrations with numerous different data source types. I have worked in Order to Cash, Finance, Assets and Service the Customer areas. 
 
Currently Lead Architect and Developer in the Client Information space. Specialties:Systems Engineering
